page.title: 012Consall & Wetley Rocks area
page.content: The area we studied is a part of the Staffordshire Moorlands.It is an area of countryside and natural beauty which is a contrast with the nearby city of Stoke on Trent and the Potteries. The population is small and housed in villages such as Wetley Rocks and Consall or in isolated farms. The land is mostly rural and the main employment is dairy farming. The land cover is grassland and is used for grazing or making silage. In the east of the area there is woodland and the beautiful Churnet valley, through which the river Churnet and Cauldon canal flow. The canal was once used for transporting raw materials for the iron industry which was important between the 17th and 19th centuries.However today it is used by the tourist industry.
